user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of OS_TimeBaseGetIdByName:
```c
int32 OS_TimeBaseGetIdByName(osal_id_t *timer_id, const char *timebase_name)
{
    int32          return_code;
    osal_objtype_t objtype;

    /* Check parameters */
    OS_CHECK_POINTER(timer_id);
    OS_CHECK_APINAME(timebase_name);

    /*
     * Check our context.  Not allowed to use the timer API from a timer callback.
     * Just interested in the object type returned.
     */
    objtype = OS_ObjectIdToType_Impl(OS_TaskGetId_Impl());
    if (objtype == OS_OBJECT_TYPE_OS_TIMEBASE)
    {
        return OS_ERR_INCORRECT_OBJ_STATE;
    }

    return_code = OS_ObjectIdFindByName(OS_OBJECT_TYPE_OS_TIMEBASE, timebase_name, timer_id);

    return return_code;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are related to the target function OS_TimeBaseGetIdByName:
#define OS_CHECK_POINTER(ptr) BUGCHECK((ptr)!=NULL,OS_INVALID_POINTER)
...
#define OS_CHECK_APINAME(str) OS_CHECK_STRING(str,OS_MAX_API_NAME,OS_ERR_NAME_TOO_LONG)
...
osal_id_t OS_TaskGetId_Impl(void)
{
    OS_VoidPtrValueWrapper_t self_record;

    /* cppcheck-suppress unreadVariable // intentional use of other union member */
    self_record.opaque_arg = pthread_getspecific(POSIX_GlobalVars.ThreadKey);

    return self_record.id;
}
...
static inline osal_objtype_t OS_ObjectIdToType_Impl(osal_id_t id)
{
    return (OS_ObjectIdToInteger(id) >> OS_OBJECT_TYPE_SHIFT);
}
...
#define OS_OBJECT_TYPE_OS_TIMEBASE 0x08
...
int32 OS_ObjectIdFindByName(osal_objtype_t idtype, const char *name, osal_id_t *object_id)
{
    int32             return_code;
    OS_object_token_t token;

    /*
     * As this is an internal-only function, calling it with NULL is allowed.
     * This is required by the file/dir/socket API since these DO allow multiple
     * instances of the same name.
     */
    ARGCHECK(name, OS_ERR_NAME_NOT_FOUND);
    LENGTHCHECK(name, OS_MAX_API_NAME, OS_ERR_NAME_TOO_LONG);

    return_code = OS_ObjectIdGetByName(OS_LOCK_MODE_GLOBAL, idtype, name, &token);
    if (return_code == OS_SUCCESS)
    {
        *object_id = token.obj_id;

        OS_ObjectIdRelease(&token);
    }

    return return_code;
}
...
#define OS_ERR_INCORRECT_OBJ_STATE (-35)
...
typedef uint32 osal_objtype_t
...
typedef uint32 osal_id_t
...
typedef int32_t   int32
</additional code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation:
Other code fragments were reviewed and are not reported because they do not on their face indicate unreachable code (Rule 2.1) and are conditional or normal control flow that can be reached at runtime:

- The objtype check and early return in OS_TimeBaseGetIdByName (the if (objtype == OS_OBJECT_TYPE_OS_TIMEBASE) { return ...; }) is a legitimate runtime conditional return, not statically unreachable.

- The call and subsequent conditional in OS_ObjectIdFindByName (return_code = OS_ObjectIdGetByName(...); if (return_code == OS_SUCCESS) { *object_id = token.obj_id; OS_ObjectIdRelease(&token); }) are normal conditional code paths that depend on runtime return_code and therefore are reachable.

- The inline OS_ObjectIdToType_Impl and OS_TaskGetId_Impl implementations are simple operations (shift of an id and read of thread-specific storage via a union wrapper) and do not contain statically unreachable code.

- The macro OS_CHECK_APINAME is included above as suspicious because it enforces non-NULL/length checks at the caller site; beyond that, its presence alone is expected and not by itself proof of unreachable code except in combination with the comment/ARGCHECK in OS_ObjectIdFindByName (which is why that combination was reported).

The reported fragments focus on places where the source text contains an apparent contradiction (a comment asserting NULL is allowed followed immediately by ARGCHECK/LENGTHCHECK that would reject NULL) and on the caller-side API-name check and pointer-check macro that create enforcement points which may render the NULL-name path impossible in practice. These are the locations that should be investigated further for potential unreachable code or contradictory contract assumptions.
